Best game ever. Good Music, good and beauty graphics, perfect gameplay and amazing story with best ending i've seen ever! 10/10. And i think, I found my love. Elizabeth
just great, can't say more. one of the best games in a long time.
Great story, beautiful graphics and scenes, but falls short as a shooter. Worth playing through at least once, but it's short and a bit tedious. Wait for a sale!
Best shooter evah!!! Awesome graphics and a mind f-ing good story!
Bioshock Infinite's Columbia is surely one of the most astonishing game worlds ever created, and no minor plot quibbles or gameplay gripes can ever detract from that.
BEST GAME EVER!

This game is really amazing. Its gameplay is really funny and the story is epic. Shootin an enemy while spawning crows which attack foes is just one possible tactic to win against the founders/the vox. 
Only thing which is a little bit anoying: playing it doesnt feel like playing Bioshock anymore. The game is bright and colorful (not the destroyed rapture style). if you never played bioshock 1&2 (or didnt liked the setting of both), this game is perfect for you. But if you really liked Bioshock, with its destroyed, dirty and brutal setting or have a problem with "bright" games, then you really shouldnt buy it, just cause it name is Bioshock.

Skills: the skills are really amazing. you can use special combos which are awesome, like Crows and fire=BURNING CROWS THAT ATTACK ENEMYS!!!!.

Story: the story is very intresting. Sometimes you will be surprised, horrified and sad when playing this well written story.took 10 hours to finish the game (died 3 times). ITS NOT AN OPEN-WORLD GAME!!!!: its separated into giant levels, so dont expect a skyrim-like-game.

Graphics: ok i dont give a s*** about graphics.
The game is really good, but its not as much good as Bioshock 1 (in my opinion) x)
Great Game, Amazing story with lots of twists, its worth every penny!!
Not the longest game in the world nor the most challenging but it has an interesting story even if the twist at the end is a little naff.

Words fail me. I absolutely adore this game. This is a game that's greater than the sum of its parts, and each of those parts are executed damn near perfectly. The shooting elements aren't revolutionary, and the game is much less cerebral than the original Bioshock. Still, I freaking love it.

Amazing (closure?) to the Bioshock series.  Very intriguing in how the story lulls you into a world of fantastical perfection and extravagance, and slowly but surely uncovers the more morbid elements, whilst taking you on a journey of many twists, turns, and new plot elements.  Actually found this edition to be superior to the previous 2 in story-telling, complexity, and engagement.  A must-play masterpiece.  10/10

Absolutely amazing game.  I cannot say enough.

It kinda remarks and plays like Bioshock 1.  Forget Bioshock 2 because that was made by different people and was pure terrible.  This is like the best of the best.

Graphics: They are sweet, some cheap graphics on stuff but then you do not notice them when running etc or go close, like the roses... They are crap but you would not stop and look at them. Overal in most aspects they are very good if you kinda do not stop to look at things up close

Game: The game so far is offering the most in depth approach to a game I have ever seen.  physx etc it is spot on.  When I say spot on I mean it could not have been done any better, I am really happy with the game and how it played out.

I cannot say enough, this game is worth every single penny you spend and never look back.  I have complete it and waiting to see what the season pass brings because I complete and now have to wait, hopefully a different section in menu.

Animations and the powers you use are top fun and really good. Specially when you change, you get an awesome mini affect which really draws your eyes too it. 

I do not have a bad point about this game to say, it is really that good and worth every penny and time you would spend on it.

I know people playing it for the 3rd and 5th time because the game is that good.

Go buy!
What a great storytelling game. The characters felt just real and the ending kept me left with my mouth opened!

A fantastic storyline combined with solid FPS gameplay combine to create an expereince that's compelling from beginning to end. My only major complain would be a couple of the combat segments near the end start to drag.
A great story and a worthy experience. Definately worth a play through.

A fun and well written story with amazing scenery that got me immersed entirely, most of the time I just wanted to stop and smell the roses, this game looked that good the best part is that you don't need to play Bioshock 1 or 2 to get the full experience. I recommend all of you to buy this great game my final verdict is a well deserved 10/10 this game was fun as hell and I never lost any interest or got board at all while playing this great game and the ending stayed in my mind at least a week after playing this game it was that amazing.

So basically you row up to a lighthouse that shoots you 15,000 feet into the air (an altitude at which everyone would freeze and die), where you land on a flying city full of magical racists.  On this city you harness the people's magical powers and kidnap a girl (which they don't take too kindly to), so you've got to kill them with their own magic.  This magic is the new kid in town, replacing the plasmids of Bioshock 1 and 2, and it's not like every freaking vigor (type of magic) mirrors the magic given to you in the first two  in the form of plasmids.  For example, Shock Jockey instead of Electro Bolt, and Murder of Crows instead of Insect Swarm.  Not to mention Undertow instead of Sonic Boom.  Oh!  Almost forgot!  A confusing, yet amazing storyline.  But whatevs.  In conclusion, impossible altitude, flying city, magical racists, new combat mechanics (as far as guns and Skylines go), and "SUPER NEW AND ORIGINAL" abilities.  So.  You know.  Great game that I already have 20.5 hours in (as of April 4).
It's absolutely exceptional.

Excelente por donde se lo mire... La historia increible con un final conmovedor. La jugabilidad perfecta con la compania de  la IA de Elizabeth que es increible. Me encantaron las armas ,los poderes , el entorno y la ambientacion que ya estamos acostumbrados a los que jugamos los anteriores. La musica bien retro y por momentos flasheas con temas mas actuales. La verdad se merece un GOTY. 10/10
Infinitamente surpreendente! Nota 10! üôÇ
So many HOLY SHIT moments. Luv it. Luv Booker. Luv  Elizabeth.

Everyone should buy this game, the story alone has placed Bioshock Infinite at the forefront of the 'Games are art' argument. Add to that Elizabeth's wonderfully detailed AI and the same run, gun & vigor gameplay that made the first game so much fun and Irrational have created something really special.

So as a big fan of the Bioshock series, when this was announced, I vowed to myself to get it on launch day and play it. Years later, I did, and after beating it straight through, I can honestlly say this is the greatest game I've ever played. The gameplay is fun and refreshing, while stll having the same "Bioshock" feel to it. The characters are full with great dialogue and personality. Both Booker and Elizabeth are wonderfully fleshed out characters, and I love them dearly. And the ending...well that is a beast on its own. This game is worth the full 60 dollars, and I'd gladly play it-and buy it, again.
This game deserves to be played, plain and simple
A story better and more complex than inception and delivered better with less plotholes.
De longe o jogo do ano. Excelente investimento
Best game ive played in a long time! The ending was the best that i have ever played and strongly recommend this game

This is the first game I pre-purchased and wasn't disappointed in all the hype and set up in many years. I came in expecting a good game and I got more then I expected, having not really enjoyed bioshock 2 as much as the first game. This game had everything I could ever ask of a bioshock title and I could find myself playing through it 2-3 more times easily. Worth $60 to me and honestly I think most people will find it worth 40-60 as well.
An unforgettable experience I have ever had, this game drives you to play further untill the end.. I loved it! not allot of Single player games that are like this!

I have got to say this is the best video game I have played in my life. Not only was the gameplay the best I'd ever experienced, but it had the most original setting since Rapture, spot on characters, intense themes of moral and political conflict, and an ending so incredibly mind blowing that I'm still literally getting chills thinking about it. Seriously, I'm a plot twist junkie, and that was the best I've ever seen in ANY medium. If you're even considering playing it, DO IT. You won't regret it- best game ever.
Beautiful!

The game's ending is a huge mindfuck wich leaves you thinking about it for days. This is truly an unforgetable game.
This is and always will be my favourite game.
(sorry Bioshock, Witcher 3 took your place as my favourite game)

In true BioShock fashion, when you think you've got it all figured out, you learn otherwise. BioShock infinite is an intimate look into American exceptionalism in the clouds. While not as scary as Rapture, Columbia similarly offers little security when traversing above the clouds. Definitely pick this up even if Rapture was your biggest love from BioShock - you will NOT be disappointed!

From top to bottom this game blew me away. Visually the art looks clean and portrays a large sense of world. Swinging from the sky rails and slamming into electrocuited baddies is great fun. Story is a little odd but I still enjoyed it. Definitely one of my favorite games of all time.

Ein Meisterwerk ohne wenn und aber. Ich war von der ersten Minute an gefesselt und schon lange nicht mehr (noch nie?) so sehr gemindfucked nach einem Ending. Ich wei√ü nicht mehr, wann ich das letzte Mal mit offenem Mund einem Abspann zugeschaut habe... wann ich das letzte Mal 1-2 Stunden √ºber ein Ending... nein √ºber einen ganzen Plot (!) nochmal nachdenken musste. Selten. Wohl nie. Die Charaktere sind unglaublich realistisch dargestellt, die K√§mpfe ein Highlight, das man selten so erf√§hrt, wie in diesem Spiel... und von der Story brauch ich wohl garnicht erst anfangen. Da kann in meinen Augen kaum ein Game mithalten... Ich werde jetzt weiterhin erstmal das Ende verdauen und mich bald dem Hardcore-Modus stellen... Klare Kaufempfehlung und definitiv mein Game of the year 2013!!

Sacr√© morceau que ce Bioshock Infinite! Totalement dissoci√© sc√©naristiquement des deux premiers opus, il en reprend n√©anmoins le gameplay, alliant FPS traditionnel √† coup de gros calibre √† des pouvoirs moins conventionnels comme la possession ou le choc √©lectrique. L'histoire prend place √† Columbia, une cit√©  qui flotte dans les airs, pendant les ann√©es 20. Le sc√©nario, ou plut√¥t la bizarrerie cosmique qui fait un pied de nez au continuum espace-temps toutes les deux minutes, est assez r√©ussi, m√™me si pass√© le postulat de d√©part, l'histoire tourne un peu en rond, avant de s'enrichir √† nouveau sur la fin du jeu, tout simplement magistrale, bourr√©e de clin d'oeils √† Bioshock 1 et prise de t√™te au possible (dans le bon sens du terme!) Graphiquement, aussi bien techniquement qu'artistiquement, Infinite est une merveille. Chaque sc√®ne est une claque visuelle, et l'environnement sonore n'est pas en reste, avec un doublage et une bande son de grande qualit√©. Au final, Bioshock Infinite m√©rite les louagnes qui lui ont √©t√© adress√©es, avec un petit b√©mol toutefois pour l'intelligence artificielle ridicule des ennemis, qui sont tout bonnement stupides. Sans parler de la r√©surrection infinie qui rend le jeu tr√®s facile m√™me lors des derniers combats. Enfin, et c'est probablement le plus gros point noir de cette version PC, aucun moyen de sauvegarder manuellement, tout se fait par checkpoint et m√™me s'ils sont nombreux, √ßa reste plus qu'handicapant par moments. La dur√©e de vie quant √† elle est plut√¥t honorable puisque le jeu se termine en une dizaine d'heures, c'est la moyenne actuelle. En bref, un excellent jeu, au sc√©nario riche, avec une ambiance digne de celle du premier volet, un gameplay enrichi, sorte de mix entre Bioshock 1 et 2. Des personnages attachants, notamment Elizabeth, une bande son g√©nial, une direction artistique √† couper le souffle. Bref, peut √™tre pas le jeu de l'ann√©e, mais n√©anmoins un excellent √©pisode de cette s√©rie, bien qu'un peu moins bon que le premier.

In terms of gameplay not as fun or deep as its predecessors. The story is moderately interesting for the most part though the world isnt as immersive as the rapture world. That being said, the ending is mind blowingly good and redeems every single flaw this game may have had. Well played sir.

Words cannot describe how great this game is, if your PC can run it, buy it now.

I've described games as 'near perfect' & I know of 2 perfect games: Half Life 2 & Bioshock.   'Near perfect' is a finished product, both compelling & good (ie. Dishonored).  Bioshock Infinite is FULLY satisfying, oh so perfectly tasty, & as close to perfect as I care to imagine.

Borrowing from nothing save it's own Bioshock canon, Bioshock Infinite leaves you wanting more & lends a sense of wonder at nearly every turn.  The cast of characters have depth & sincerity.  The story isn't just good, it's deep.  The plot has actual twists & turns that leave you guessing.  The environment is compelling & complex.  The game itself is flawless (no crashes/glitches) & the gameplay is complex.

I shouldn't be surprised really.  This is the team that brought us Bioshock in the first place, but I am perfectly, happily, & gratifyingly surprised.

Two things:  First, I totally called that this was a prequel & I'm stoked about that.  Second, the best surprise is the use of real science & theoretical physics to explain the whole time-travelling wibbly wobbly timey wimey shinanigans plotline... awesomeness.

This is seriously one of the best games I've played in a long, long time. The plot is one of the most cerebral ones I've seen, in a good way, and despite how much "Escort" made me cry in fear, Elizabeth is a REALLY good character, who manages to fend for herself and not be a chore to defend. My only real complaints are that you can only carry two weapons at once and there's no manual save-points, only checkpoints. Despite that, if you've got the money, this is completely worth the purchase.

A great new entry into the Bio Shock universe. Everything great about the old ones and more!

Even though this is an over hyped game it's a lot of fun with same gameplay as the other bioshocks (without hacking this) but finally puts in modern controls and PC controls feel way better to it plus a great story and DLC is on the way for a  single player game. But the game is pricy plus the season pass is 20 dollars unless you want to get it now with the pass it's a lot of money.
